channel.title: RSCEmulation Replica - A RuneScape Classic Server
channel.description:
[url=http://www.rscemulation.org]RSCEmulation Replica - A RuneScape Classic Server[/url]
RSCEmulation Replica is a server aimed at replicating RuneScape Classic, with the exception of subtle modifications (such as experience rates). Our goal is to bring you a quality server, stability, security, and the nostalgia of playing RuneScape Classic by Jagex. Our predecessor, now know as RSCEmulation V1 (which is a twist on RuneScape Classic) was a very successful server, for the majority of time it was up (5 years). Our plan is to bring yet another successful launch, and attempt at bringing you nothing but the best quality, RuneScape Classic replicated server.
[b]Experience Rates:[/b] Combat Stats: 5x / 5.5x for subscribers. Skilling Stats: 3x / 3.5x for subscribers.
[b]Getting Started:[/b] 1. Visit [url=http://www.rscemulation.org]RSCEmulation's website[/url] to [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/register.php]register an account[/url]. 2. Navigate to the [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/rsce_character.php]Character Hub[/url] to create a character. 3. Either download our [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/ClientLoader.jar]Client Loader[/url] or visit our [url=http://replica.rscemulation.org]Web Client[/url] to log in to your newly created character, which you created in step 2.
[b]Subscriber Benefits:[/b] As a subscriber, you'll receive benefits over non-subscribed accounts. Some of the benefits are as follows: - The ability to toggle FOW (not toggable in the wilderness). - The aiblity to toggle roofs (not toggable in the wilderness). - The ability to use Global Chat. - The ability to stake in F2P area. - The ability to use thieving and fletching in F2P area.
[b]Support / Troubleshooting:[/b] If you encounter any issues creating an account, or logging in to the game, feel free to create a thread on the [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/forum.php]Forum[/url] and we'll do our best to get you playing in a timely manner.
[IMG]http://i.imgur.com/rU89ym6l.png[/img] [IMG]http://i.imgur.com/ZqZySqfl.png[/img]
[b]RSCEmulation[/b] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org]Website[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/login.php]Login[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/register.php]Register[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/forum.php]Forum[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/faq.php]FAQ[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/rules.php]Rules[/url] [url=http://www.rscemulation.org/subscribe.php]Subscribe[/url]

item.title: RSCEmulation Replica - A RuneScape Classic Server
item.dc:creator: @Nothing1 -Nothing
item.description:
@Nothing1 wrote:

[quote=“gawdz666, post:105, topic:545782”]Im so glad its java’s fault that it def 100% doesnt support anything past 4 bytes. Oh fudge nvm

https://docs.oracle.com/javase/7/docs/api/java/math/BigInteger.html

All you need to do is convert the stackable amounts in mysql to big int’s and anything stackable in the client to a big int.

Jesus fudgeing christ.

[quote author=vortex link=topic=664666.msg4502218#msg4502218 date=1452617870]
hahahahah
[/quote][quote author=Ecko link=topic=664666.msg4502226#msg4502226 date=1452626972]
hahahahah

[/quote][quote author=Lothy link=topic=664666.msg4502199#msg4502199 date=1452596369]
Well that’s really cute.
[/quote][/quote]
You can’t really use BigInteger for that. However, big-int(8 bytes) in SQL is same as long(8 bytes) in Java, which is probably what you meant.

Read full topic

Not only that, there’s multiple easy ways to fix that issue but you chose to lie to your users, blame the programming language and not do a damn thing.

item.title: RSCEmulation Replica - A RuneScape Classic Server
item.dc:creator: @Zach_Knight Zach Knight
item.description:
@Zach_Knight wrote:

The message they sent you was:

Hey there I have gone on a date with Dustin Harrison and when I asked what he did for a living he said he made a 2-d nostalgic game and did software development for administration and so forth but when I asked for the game name he didn’t want to mix business with pleasure. So his ex gf told me the game because a friend knows her and I came across your post. I feel like there is much fishy things about him and I have questions about the game.
Thanks


I have no clue who’d sent this to me, or on which moparscape account it was sent to, but I can reply here and assume the person will read it.
Dustin has not to my knowledge done much ``software development’’ for this project, at all. He has made PHP contributions from my understanding, and has done minor work to the actual games codebase here and there(with large problems, usually). It is an extraordinarily fishy project, and his acquisition of it was fishy as well, basically having stolen it from a dead mans family, allegedly. He has allegedly attempted to rip off certain developers that I know for free labor, and has occasionally had long discussions with me in regards to issues he has had with certain parts of the codebase, and he has paid me for certain minor contributions on occasion. He has allegedly been involved in illegal activities in relation to this project, as recently as a few months ago.
He does administrative work there, for sure, and frankly it is unsurprising that he would not go into much detail when having discussed the project with you in person. Basically the entire community has a generalized hatred toward him, and his practices involved in the project.

Read full topic
